rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CE.CEOCCUR

datasetVariables.description: Used when the occurrence of specific events is solicited to indicate whether or not a clinical event occurred. Values are null for spontaneously reported events.

datasetVariables.name: CEOCCUR

datasetVariables.name: CEREASND

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CE.CEBODSYS

datasetVariables.description: Dictionary-derived. Body system or organ class that is involved in an event or measurement from a standard hierarchy (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.
datasetVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class
datasetVariables.name: CEBODSYS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CE.CESTRF

datasetVariables.description: Describes the start of the clinical event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics).
datasetVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariables.name: CESTRF

datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariables.name: CEENRF

description: An events domain that contains clinical events of interest that would not be classified as adverse events. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C85441, 2018-06-29)
label: Clinical Events
name: CE
